lines.name: IRA
lines.line: I didn‚Äôt fill the prescription, if that‚Äôs what you‚Äôre wondering. There are no protagonists yet to emerge. My room is still a mess; my relationships are waiting to miraculously appear‚Ä¶ </br></br>But, I slept a full eight hours last night. </br></br>I talked to some random guy on the tram after seeing Dr Bunt. I told him everything. Poor guy, probably didn‚Äôt expect a summary of my last three years with a "hey, are you ok?".</br></br>I told him about her.</br></br>That I can‚Äôt help but feel like it‚Äôs my fault if anything happens to her. </br></br>Because I never reported anything. He told me I shouldn‚Äôt hold onto my guilt, and that if I was really worried, I should contact her. I couldn‚Äôt stop thinking, what if I do - and she tells him, and it comes back to me and suddenly he really is standing in front of me, accusing me of accusing him of... </br></br>Doing what he did.</br></br>I messaged her last night. I don‚Äôt know if she‚Äôll reply. But I feel more awake now. I‚Äôm ready, if she does.
